Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 05:39PM batlady wrote: Birdlady,  I am so sorry you are in this situation--I agree, it's horrifying.  I went to my breast specialist this morning for a 3 month follow up this morning.  I am 29 years old, and have had "lumpy breasts" for years.  Last year, I had moved and started with a new gyno, who wanted me to get a mammo and ultrasound.  I freaked out big time, but got the tests done, and the Dr. told me there was nothing to worry about--everything looked benign, and to get another mammogram when I turn 35.  Ok.  Around July or August, I began to notice a green discharge from my left nipple (my left side is the "problem side"), so I freaked out, and went back to the Dr.  I then went to a breast specialist, who did an exam, and thought everything seemed fine, but wanted me to come back in 3 months for a follow up.  That was this morning.  I hadn't noticed any changes over the past 3 months, so I wasn't even worried.  But he found 2 to 3 swollen nodes under my left arm, and seemed somewhat alarmed, so of course now I am convinced of the worst!  I have an appointment now for tomorrow (Friday) to get another mammogram and ultrasound, and possibly a biopsy.  I am so scared!  I've cried all day, haven't gotten any work done, and am dreading tomorrow.  My husband is so supportive, and keeps assuring me that I shouldn't stress and think the worst until I complete these additional tests, but that's easier said than done (as I think you know).  I just feel like I have so much left to do in life.  I'm right in the middle of making my career, and the rest of my life.  I am just so afraid of all that being taken away from me.  All I have thought about all day is being sick and being confined to a bed, unable to enjoy life.  Anyways, good luck to you.  You aren't alone.
Posts.Title: Scared sh*tless birdlady1979 birdlady1979
